comments.commentBody: Yes - even though their times are not officially recorded, they all get medals!!
Fine. It's an achievement. It is not "running a marathon."
It's 26.whatever. They did the distancePERIOD!

For anyone complaining about the pace of late finishers: try walking a Marathon distance on concrete and see how it feels. I walked the Great Saunter in May - 33 miles around the perimeter of Manhattan - and that was a killer. A lot of pain, a fair amount of damage. Even doing the distance in about 8:45. "Older human walking pace" is not so easy to sustain for that distance, whatever you might think. It's great that you were able to run it, and I'm very impressed. Hats off. But walking is no picnic, either.

Courageous - good for them.

It's great they had each other, harder to keep going without support.

For young people reading this, it was only about 40 years ago that women were not allowed to run these events.
Repeat - kept out deliberately by the men who organized the events.

It was your brave moms, aunts and millions of other women, awakening to their power and quest for justice, that changed this nation. For the better.

Their fight to change minds and hearts and the soul of America was the ultimate long-game marathon.
And we run the race still…

Hormone therapy or not, as long as we continue to have gender specific bathrooms and changing areas, we should have separate, probably private, spaces for transgender individuals. Why? To be consistent. Boys and Girls rooms exist so we don't have to look at the genitalia of the other sex. That should not change simply because someone with a penis says they are female (yes, I understand that they *are* female, whatever that means). But if a girl's penis is okay, anyone's penis should be, in which case we should completely abolish gender specific areas altogether. Probably decrease overall bathroom wait times as a nice side effect too.

Oh, please. If it were that easy they would already be doing it, and they would be so transparently obvious as to be ridiculous.  It's not easy for any "boy" to express femininity. It's not "cool" or "hip" to be born a boy who actually feels more like a girl to the point that he feels like he has to transition to express his true gender.  It is not even allowable for a boy who wants to be a boy but likes traditionally "feminine" things to live his life without ridicule and harassment. So, no, there will be no thousands of horny teenaged boys claiming to be girls. That's a ridiculous fantasy of the ignorant.

Yes, because everyone knows that teenage boys never feel self-conscious, or worry about embarrassing themselves in front of their peers, let alone teachers, administrators, parents, and on and on....

Does anyone really think that the average 16-year-old boy is going to say, "Niiiice....I'm gonna be a girl for the next couple days so I can have easy access to all those chicks in he locker room!" then proceed to try attracting those female students? Have teenaged boys changed so drastically since my brothers were that age, and now have zero concern of what their peers might think, or what it would mean for them to fake being transgendered to both peers and authority??

Somehow I doubt that there is a secret epidemic of boys wanting to pretend they are temporarily girls just so they can access a locker room, or rest room, or anywhere else....
If the Feds prevail on this, it will not end well.  I can see literally thousands of horny teenaged boys claiming to be girls just to get into the shower room with the real girls.
Sorry,  but being a thirteen or fourteen years old girl and being uncomfortable with your teammates penis  isn't hateful.

GWE, you're missing the point.

The key here is a phenomenon called "identifies as".
So... Someone with gender dysphoria should get a free pass to their locker room of choice, and someone with anorexia gets a get out of lunch free card. Same logic.
@Edward Allen: If you really believe nobody should mind at all, well then you go ahead, get out there and expose your private parts to girls.  Live your beliefs.  Let us know how it goes over.
Over 80% of MtF transgender individuals keep their p3nises.

If the physical transformation has not been completed, and we have a girl in a boy's body, it's not unreasonable to be sensitive to the needs of all the girls in the locker room, not just the transgender teen.  Private changing facilities for everyone desiring them might have been a reasonable solution.

I wouldn't like to have to see their privates. Even as an adult woman in a locker room, or shower I don't want to see a stranger's penis, no matter how disassociated they are with it because that's not the point.
You're joking, right?

The short answer is you don't understand. As the article points out, the young person in question has identified as a girl since youth and is receiving hormone therapy. If things have gotten that far, the young person has probably been through many psychiatrists. Gender dysphoria is condition recognized by mental health professionals, so no - this isn't just an excuse to go into the girl's locker room to have a peak.

This is a NYT pick? Makes me wonder how serious NYT is on this issue.

no, you are ignoring the fact that regardless of what the student believes, he is not a girl. he can live his life according to what he believes being a girl would be like but in reality he is not. being a girl is not something you get to pick and other people shouldn't have to feel uncomfortable because one person has to live out his version of his truth.
The LGBT movement needs to drop the T if they want to continue successfully....

This is "Alice in Wonderland" crazy. "She wants to be accepted for who she is"...he is a boy with a penis in a girls locker room.  And no matter how many hormones he takes or surgeries he has he will always be a biological male.  This is one thing you do not get to choose.  Why should 99.9% of the population change their ways to suit you.

There are already several examples of transgender "females" (obvious males with male upper body development) who have been allowed to compete as women, and have wiped the floor with their competitors.  They're photographed grinning with their first place medal, while genuine women gamely try to smile in 2nd and 3rd place. It's a way for men who can't win against other men to triumph in sports, and their unfair biological advantage doesn't seem to bother them one bit.
Your daughter is more rational than those "federal education authorities ".
I will try adding chopped apple with my onions.  That sounds like a nice addition.  Not too sure about the cloves and cinnamon.  I liked used a cup of lentils.  It keeps the protein up.

I was intrigued by this recipe when I first saw it but am glad I came here to read about others' experiences. Based on the comments, I adapted the recipe as follows and was very pleased with the result: increased squash to 2 lbs., decreased lentils to 1/2 c., used 1 qt. chicken broth for the liquid, sauteed 1 chopped apple along with the onions, used ground spices: 1/2 tsp. cumin, 1 tsp. coriander, 1/8 tsp. mustard, pinch each of cloves and cinnamon, 1/4 tsp. black pepper, 1 tsp. salt.

If perfect square ends with 0, express it as 10 X a number N. Now since 10 is not a perfect square, the number N must be a multiple of another perfect square and 10. But then the original perfect square number must be a multiple of 100 and cannot have 950 as the last three digits. A perfect cube must have three zeros at the end.

This report does not include all the facts of this case. From what I have read elsewhere, the "defiant" (and I have problems with that adjective) student was not a trouble maker. I regard the teacher as the root cause of this horror story. He or she should have realized that this was an unusual behavior for this ordinarily quiet girl. Allowing the situation to escalate to what we see in the video is probably going to result in a lawsuit for the school and possibly for the teacher as well.

Yes, you can use yogurt to cut calories. I used 1 cup Greek style and it worked perfectly. Perhaps drier than heavy cream but didn't look any different from the picture.

Used a bit more cayenne for kick and then topped with thyme rather than chives. Maybe less turmeric and a bit more cumin? Anyway, it was great, loved it!
Well written, nice.

Exactly correct. I wonder how many people have actually had to live through making decisions like this. I personally have. In the Philippines there is a much higher ratio of transgenders than what I see here in the States. When I was working over there some of the transgender females would use the restroom of the ladies. Employees (female) would come up to me that they are NOT comfortable with the situation.

A lot of people here are worried about the transgender and hurting her feelings. I feel for her, I really do, but the issue here is now that there are students in the female locker room that are not comfortable showing and changing around a transgender. That's the end of it, right there. Are you people saying that those that are complaining (children, mind you) should be forced to accept this?

"The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few" applies here. You're forcing a position upon a number of people that have voiced their concern with this.
I don't want my young daughter to witness the male genitilia of another person, PERIOD.  Is that too much to ask ???
